org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: controller.applicationname
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: controller app name

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: zwave.commLayer
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Choose either PAD or RXTX depending on your communication layer to use.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: amx_ni.address
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Address of the AMX NI processor, mandatory.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: protocol.zwave.classname
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Z-Wave CommandBuilder class. This entry should not be changed.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: amx_ni.port
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: TCP port the AMX module is listening on, mandatory.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: multicast.port
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: multicast port for listening to the iPhone auto discovery

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: enocean.comPort
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Serial port the EnOcean interface is found on.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: controller.groupmember.autodetect.on
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Specify whether auto-detect group member function is turned on (true/false). If it's false, the controller will get the groupmembers from the key named "controller.groupmember.candidate.urls" of current configuration file. If it's true, controller will auto-detect its groupmembers with multicast.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: controller.roundrobin.multicast.port
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Multicast port for roundrobin NOTE: This option is useful only on the situation of "controller.roundrobin.on" is true.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: samsungTV.address
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Address of the samsung TV to use.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: webapp.port
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: This is the port number the controller returns on a panel discovery request. It *must* match the port number configured on the hosting web container. If you change your web container port, change this port value to match or the panel auto-discovery will not work correctly. TODO: This is a duplicate configuration to the web container and should be consolidated. It should only be necessary to define the port number in one location. This may mean wrapping the web container with a proper service container.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: zwave.pad.port
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: If PAD is used for communication this defines the port the PAD daemon is listening on.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: copy.lircd.conf.on
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: If true, controller will copy a deployed lircd.conf to lircd.conf.path of the user TODO : This is disruptive to the user's system. The additional remotes deployed to OR controller should be concatenated to the end of an existing lircd.conf file.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: vera.address
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: The IP address of your Vera box.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: controller.roundrobin.multicast.address
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Multicast address for roundrobin NOTE: This option is useful only on the situation of "controller.roundrobin.on" is true.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: domintell.port
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: UDP port of the DETH02 interface used to connect to the Domintell system, mandatory.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: lircd.conf.path
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Default path to lircd.conf (IR commands)

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: zwave.comPort
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Serial port the Z-Wave stick is found on. Either local serial port or serial port on PAD host depending on commLayer setting.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: lutron_homeworks.username
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: User name used for connection to Lutron HomeWorks processor, as defined on Link 9 in HomeWorks configuration.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: protocol.vera.classname
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Vera CommandBuilder class. This entry should not be changed.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: irsend.path
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: The following properties are relevant if you are using infrared integration via Linux LIRC project. Otherwise ignore them. Path to LIRC irsend command. Configure this to match the location of your LIRC binary.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: domintell.address
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Address of the DETH02 interface used to connect to the Domintell system, mandatory.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: lutron_homeworks.address
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Address of the Lutron HomeWorks processor, to be filled in only of autodiscovery is not desired.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: controller.roundrobin.tcpserver.port
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Round robin tcpserver socket port of Controller

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: velbus.server.ports
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Port of the Velbus <> TCP server. If multiple networks are needed then these should be entered as ‘;’ separated values with no spaces.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: resource.upload.enable
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: If deploying the controller to public network, always disable (set to 'false') this resource upload feature. This is a convenience feature for home users for easy deployment of the controller in cases where all users of the network are trusted, or the controller is still being configured and tested. Even home users should consider disabling this feature once they're happy and want to lock down the configuration of the controller. When this feature is disabled, copy all the controller configuration files manually to a directory pointed by the 'resource.path' property below. Access to this directory in the filesystem should be properly secured with access restrictions.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: velbus.server.hostnames
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Address or name of the Velbus <> TCP server. If multiple networks are needed then these should be entered as ‘;’ separated values with no spaces.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: enocean.serialProtocol
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: EnOcean serial protocol version supported by the EnOcean interface.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: lutron_homeworks.password
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Password used for connection to Lutron HomeWorks processor, as defined on Link 9 in HomeWorks configuration.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: marantz_avr.address
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Address of the Marantz receiver, mandatory.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: protocol.velbus.classname
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Velbus CommandBuilder class. This entry should not be changed.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: controller.groupname
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: This identifies which group this controller is in.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: rules.editor
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Content for the modeler_rules.drl file. This has to be a valid Drools .drl file syntax.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: multicast.address
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: multicast address for listening to the iPhone auto discovery

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: zwave.pad.host
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: If PAD is used for communication this defines the host/ip of the machine the PAD daemon is running on.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: lutron_homeworks.port
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Telnet port of the Lutron HomeWorks processor, to be filled in only of autodiscovery is not desired.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: Macro.IR.Execution.Delay
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Macro execution delay. By default there's a delay between commands executed in a macro. Slow receiver devices (for example most TVs controlled via infrared) won't be able to process commands without significant delay. Mostly this is necessary for infrared. Other protocols may be able to process commands faster or without any delay at all. The measure is in milliseconds (500ms = 0.5s).

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: enocean.commLayer
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Choose either PAD or RXTX depending on your communication layer to use.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: protocol.alarm.classname
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Alarm CommandBuilder class. This entry should not be changed.

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: lagarto_network.broadcast
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Broadcast address and port used by all lagarto servers to publish network events (ZeroMQ pub/sub endpoint).

org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.name: protocol.samsungTV.classname
org.openremote.modeler.shared.dto.Contro.hint: Samsung TV CommandBuilder class. This entry should not be changed.
